Title: Mapping our conservation future: scoping workshop
Meetings summary: The Mapping our conservation future: scoping workshop focused on scaling up ambition for area-based conservation. It brought together an international collection of biodiversity-related institutions to discuss three key questions: 1) How can we provide meaningful data on biodiversity at a scale needed for decision making? 2) What is needed for the biodiversity community to speak with one voice on biodiversity prioritisation - i.e. where is important to focus conservation efforts? 3)How can we assess where important biodiversity is, and is not, being effectively managed?
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This workshop explored options to scale-up area based conservation beyond 2020.
Link to further information: A workshop report is available on request: post-2020@unep-wcmc.org

Title: 1st meeting of the IUCN WCPA Beyond the Aichi Targets Task Force
Meetings summary: The IUCN's World Commission on Protected Areas (WCPA) meeting focused on developing an engagement and technical strategy to scale up area-based conservation.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The Task Force will assist Convention on Biological Diversity (CBD) Parties to build momentum for the Promise of Sydney to scale up conservation.

Title: IMPAC 4
Meetings summary: The Fourth International Marine Protected Areas Congress (IMPAC 4) brought together stakeholders to define recommendations on policy processes and to assist in establishing a global network of effectively managed Marine Protected Areas. Particular focus was placed on ocean-human relationships and the impacts of Marine Protected Areas.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The conference was an opportunity to assess progress towards delivering on the Strategic Plan for Biodiversity 2011-2020 and its Aichi Biodiversity Targets on marine conservation.

Title: Half-Earth Day
Organisers: E. O. Wilson Biodiversity Foundation, National Geographic
Meetings summary: The Fourth International Marine Protected Areas Congress (IMPAC 4) brought together stakeholders to define recommendations on policy processes and to assist in establishing a global network of effectively managed Marine Protected Areas. Particular focus was placed on ocean-human relationships and the impacts of Marine Protected Areas.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: Half-Earth is one initiative looking at how to manage half of the planet for nature.

Title: GEO-XIV Plenary
Meetings summary: This meeting explored the use and applications of Earth observations with stakeholders from the global network of the Group on Earth Observations (GEO).
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The GEO Plenary provided an opportunity to exchange knowledge, identify gaps and reduce duplication in the areas of sustainable development and environmental management.

Title: 1st Bogis-Bossey Dialogue for Transformational Change on Biodiversity
Meetings summary: The Secretariat of the Convention on Biological Diversity (CBD) convened the first of a series of dialogues, with the support of the Government of Switzerland. The goal was to identify a transformative agenda for action in sectors and domains that have an impact on or benefit from biodiversity.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The meeting provided the opportunity to identify how the CBD and wider biodiversity community can leverage transformational change, both in the lead up to 2020 and through the post-2020 global biodiversity framework.

Title: UNEA 3
Meetings summary: The meeting of the UN Environment Assembly (UNEA 3) brought together Member States and a variety of stakeholders to address the issue of pollution.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This meeting provided an opportunity to consult on how linkages between pollution and biodiversity can be more effectively integrated into the future post-2020 biodiversity framework.

Title: WWF Towards a new CBD Strategy 2021-2030 First International Workshop
Meetings summary: This is the first in a series of meetings to discuss the vision, mission and five strategic goals of the current Strategic Plan 2011-2020. The following questions were addressed: 1. Should the vision, mission, and five strategic goals be maintained, adjusted, or amended? 2. Do we need additional goals until 2030 to better link with the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs)?
Relevance to the post-2020 process: Intermediate results were presented at the margins of SBSTTA-21, SBSTTA-22 and SBI-2. The discussion paper will be presented at the 14th Conference of the Parties 2018 in Egypt.

Title: CBD SBSTTA-21
Meetings summary: The Convention on Biological Diversity's (CBD) twenty-first Meeting of the Subsidiary Body on Scientific, Technical and Technological Advice (SBSTTA-21) focussed on information concerning biodiversity-related scenarios and related scientific and technical information on trends and projections towards 2050 and possible pathways to achieve the 2050 Vision.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This meeting presented the opportunity to provide policy relevant syntheses of future pathways for biodiversity and ecosystem services.

Title: International Water Summit 2018
Meetings summary: The Summit brought together stakeholders to develop new strategies on sustainable water use and technologies.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This Summit provided an opportunity to engage with the water sector on how linkages between water and biodiversity can be more effectively integrated into the future post-2020 biodiversity framework

Title: Technical Expert Workshop on Other Effective Area-Based Conservation Measures for Achieving Aichi Biodiversity Target 11
Meetings summary: This workshop aimed to provide scientific and technical advice on definition, management approaches, and identification of other effective area-based conservation measures in the terrestrial realm, as well as their role in achieving Aichi Biodiversity Target 11.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: Future targets are likely to consider other effective area-based conservation measures in terrestrial and marine realms.

Title: Expert Workshop on Marine Protected Areas and Other Effective Area-based Conservation Measures for Achieving Aichi Biodiversity Target 11 in Marine and Coastal Areas
Meetings summary: This workshop aimed to provide scientific and technical advice on definition, management approaches, and identification of other effective area-based conservation measures in the marine realm, as well as their role in achieving Aichi Biodiversity Target 11.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: Future targets are likely to consider other effective area-based conservation measures in terrestrial and marine realms.

Title: 9th Session of the World Urban Forum
Meetings summary: The Ninth Session of the World Urban Forum (WUF9) focused on the New Urban Agenda, as agreed at Habitat III, as an approach to achieve Agenda 2030 and the Sustainable Development Goals.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This represented an opportunity to engage in discussions on the linkages between cities and biodiversity

Title: Deadline for comments on the draft document: 'proposals for a comprehensive and participatory process for the preparation of the post-2020 biodiversity framework'
Meetings summary: A draft document on 'proposals for a comprehensive and participatory process for the preparation of the post-2020 biodiversity framework' was made available for peer review. The deadline for comments, as well as any other relevant input, was 16 February 2018.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The present note has been prepared by the Executive Secretary to provide the Subsidiary Body on Implementation with proposals concerning the process for the development of a follow up to the Strategic Plan for Biodiversity 2011-2020. It drew on the submissions received in response to a notification issued inviting Parties, other Governments, relevant organisations and indigenous peoples and local communities to provide comments and inputs on the process for developing the post 2020 global biodiversity framework. It also drew on experiences in developing the Strategic Plan for Biodiversity 2011-2020 in the lead-up to the tenth meeting of the Conference of the Parties.

Title: Symposium on Safeguarding space for nature, securing our future: developing a post-2020 strategy
Organisers: ZSL, NGS, UNEP-WCMC, IUCN, BirdLife International
Meetings summary:
The meeting focused on:
(1) reviewing the science informing future area-based conservation targets 
(2) evaluating the implications of various policy options 
(3) provide balanced, evidence-based recommendations to Parties to the CBD and other policy processes and 
(4) raise awareness of the need for a more ambitious, holistic and effective strategy on space for nature, incorporating protected areas and other effective area-based conservation measures.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The meeting was used to prepare an information document (yet to be published) to inform discussion on the post-2020 global biodiversity framework at COP14, and if possible at the preparatory meetings in 2018.

Title: UN World Wildlife Day 2018
Meetings summary: UN World Wildlife Day celebrates and raises awareness of the world's wild animals and plants. The theme for World Wildlife Day 2018 was "Big Cats".
Relevance to the post-2020 process: World Wildlife Day aims to raise awareness of biodiversity which relates to Aichi Biodiversity Target 12 of the Strategic Plan for Biodiversity 2011-2020.

Title: 2nd Bogis-Bossey Dialogue for Transformational Change on Biodiversity
Meetings summary: This was the second in a series of dialogues, convened by the Secretariat of the CBD with the support of the Government of Switzerland. This meeting brought Parties together to discuss the outcomes of the first dialogue and identify a transformative agenda for action.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The meeting provided an opportunity to contribute to discussions on an ambitious, innovative, yet pragmatic post-2020 global biodiversity framework.

Title: World Ocean Summit 2018
Meetings summary: The World Ocean Summit brought together business, government and civil society to consider how the ocean is used.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The Summit presented an opportunity for stakeholders, in particular the private sector, to scale up ambitions for the sustainable use of the oceans.

Title: IPBES-6 Plenary
Meetings summary: The sixth meeting of the Intergovernmental Science-Policy Platform on Biodiversity and Ecosystem Services (IPBES-6) discussed implementation of the work programme 2014-2018, deliverables and assessments.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This Plenary provided an opportunity to discuss how regional and sub-regional assessments can be used in planning and delivering of the post-2020 biodiversity agenda.

Title: 8th World Water Forum
Meetings summary: The World Water Forum brings together individuals and organisations interested in the theme of water, the nine forum themes and the 17 Sustainable Development Goals.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This meeting provided an opportunity to enhance linkages between water and biodiversity

Title: CCI Expert Workshop: Framing the Future for Biodiversity
Organisers: UNEP-WCMC, BirdLife International, RSPB, Cambridge University, IUCN, Defra, CBD Secretariat, UN Environment, JNCC
Meetings summary: The Cambridge Conservation Initiative (CCI) convened a workshop that brought together key players involved in different aspects of developing and implementing plans and strategies for the conservation and sustainable use of biodiversity, and reviewing their implementation.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This meeting provided an opportunity to examine the evidence base required to underpin the development of the new biodiversity framework .

Title: Many voices - one nature
Organisers: CBD Secretariat, UNEP-WCMC, BirdLife International, RSPB, Cambridge University, IUCN
Meetings summary: This meeting was the first in a dialogue series on transformative change in communicating biodiversity and nature, which brought together communication experts to exchange and coordinate information on existing ongoing communication activities.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This meeting explored the most effective mechanisms to ensure coherent messages and activities in the lead up to 2020.

Title: World Conference on Marine Biodiversity 2018
Meetings summary: The 4th World Conference on Marine Biodiversity brought together scientists, practitioners, and policy makers to discuss and advance our understanding of the importance and current state of biodiversity in the marine environment.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This conference provided an opportunity to discuss strategies for conservation of marine biodiversity in the context of the current Strategic Plan for Biodiversity 2011-2020.

Title: International Day for Biological Diversity 2018
Meetings summary: This day was aimed at increasing an understanding and awareness of biodiversity issues. The theme this year was to celebrate 25 years of action for biodiversity.

Title: World Environment Day 2018
Meetings summary: World Environment Day is the United Nations’ day for encouraging worldwide awareness and action for the protection of our environment. The theme for 2018 was plastic pollution, and the day was celebrated in over 100 countries.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The day provides an opportunity for driving the momentum and public pressure for the upcoming CBD 14th meeting of the Conference of the Parties (COP14).

Title: World Oceans Day 2018
Meetings summary: World Oceans Day is a day of ocean celebration, aiming to increase collaboration on ocean issues. The focus for 2018 was on preventing plastic pollution and encouraging solutions for a healthy ocean.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The day provided an opportunity to raise awareness of the problems facing our ocean.

Title: 5th European Congress of Conservation Biology
Meetings summary: The theme of the Fifth European Congress of Conservation Biology (ECCB2018-5) was planetary wellbeing – a concept that captures the wellbeing of people as well as the integrity and sustainability of Earth's ecosystems.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: ECCB2018-5 provided a forum to discuss and develop solutions for some of the key challenges faced by humanity by bringing together natural and social scientists, practitioners, industry members and government decision-makers.

Title: International Expert Workshop on Biodiversity Mainstreaming in the Sectors of Energy and Mining, Manufacturing and Processing and Infrastructure
Meetings summary: This Expert Meeting, on mainstreaming biodiversity into sectors, brought together experts from a number of fields including academia, businesses, governments and other organisations. Outputs of this meeting fed into the Convention’s second meeting of the Subsidiary Body on Implementation (SBI-2), which took place in July 2018.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The agenda included the implications of mainstreaming for the post-2020 global biodiversity framework.

Title: 5th International Marine Conservation Congress
Meetings summary: The 5th International Marine Conservation Congress (IMCC5) brought together conservation professionals and students to connect and advance the latest scientific information on Ocean management.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: IMCC5 provided an opportunity for the marine science community to voice its knowledge and recommendations to inform the development of a post-2020 biodiversity agenda.

Title: CBD SBSTTA-22
Meetings summary: The Convention on Biological Diversity's (CBD) twenty-second meeting of the Subsidiary Body on Scientific, Technical and Technological Advice (SBSTTA-22) focused on scientific and technical preparation for the CBD COP in November 2018.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The meeting included discussions regarding the follow up to the Strategic Plan for Biodiversity 2011-2020. Of particular relevance was the ongoing review of progress towards the Strategic Plan for Biodiversity 2011-2020 and options for accelerating progress.

Title: 4th Blue Planet Symposium
Meetings summary: The 4th Group on Earth Observations (GEO) Blue Planet Symposium served as a forum for discussion of ocean and coastal information needs for sustainable development, Blue Growth and societal awareness. The symposium brought together producers of ocean and coastal information and current and potential users of ocean and coastal information.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This event aimed to bridge the gap between data and services, to deliver usable information that supports informed decision-making and address policy mandates toward reaching sustainable development.

Title: CBD SBI-2
Meetings summary: The Convention on Biological Diversity's (CBD) second meeting of the Subsidiary Body on Implementation (SBI-2) focused on progress in the implementation preparation for the CBD COP in November 2018.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The meeting included discussions regarding the follow up to the Strategic Plan for Biodiversity 2011-2020. Of particular relevance was the ongoing review of implementation of the Strategic Plan for Biodiversity 2011-2020 and synergies with other conventions.

Title: Seminar on Transformational Change for the Biodiversity Agenda
Meetings summary: A half-day seminar was convened in the margins of SBSTTA-22 and SBI-2, to provide and share insights on transformational change for biodiversity.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The seminar provided an opportunity for a wider group of participants from all Parties and observers to engage on the topic of transformational change for biodiversity in the lead-up to 2020 and preparation for the post-2020 global biodiversity framework.

Title: Committee on Fisheries (COFI 33)
Meetings summary: The Food and Agriculture Organisation (FAO) Committee on Fisheries (COFI) presently constitutes a global inter-governmental forum where major international fisheries and aquaculture problems and issues are examined and recommendations addressed to governments, regional fishery bodies, NGOs, fish workers, FAO and the international community, periodically on a world-wide basis.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The agenda covered biodiversity, including biodiversity mainstreaming in the work of FAO concerning fisheries and aquaculture.

Title: High-level Political Forum on Sustainable Development 2018
Meetings summary: The theme of the High-level Political Forum on Sustainable Development (HLPF) 2018 was: "Transformation towards sustainable and resilient societies". The sub-set of Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) which were reviewed in depth was: SDG 6, 7, 11, 12, 15 and 17.In addition, 48 countries presented their Voluntary National Reviews (VNRs).
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The HLPF has a central role in the follow-up and review of the 2030 SDGs at the global level. The forum provided an opportunity to demonstrate how biodiversity underpins all of the 17 SDGs.

Title: Committee on Forests (COFO 24)
Meetings summary: The Food and Agriculture Organisation (FAO) Committee on Forestry (COFO) brought together heads of forest services and other senior government officials to identify emerging policy and technical issues, to seek solutions and to advise FAO and others on appropriate action.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This Committee provided the opportunity to discuss linkages between biodiversity and forestry-related issues.

Title: African Ministerial Conference on the Environment
Meetings summary: The Seventh Special Session of the African Ministerial Conference on the Environment (AMCEN) considered key issues to be discussed at the fourth United Nations Environment Assembly (UNEA-4) and Africa’s common approach for engagement in the Assembly. The conference focussed on how environmental challenges can be addressed through innovative solutions and interventions and by promoting sustainable consumption and production.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The special session provided an opportunity for the continent to prepare for CBD COP14, which will include discussions on the process for developing the post-2020 global biodiversity framework.

Title: UNGA 73
Meetings summary: 73rd Session of the UN General Assembly (UNGA 73) brought together all 193 Member States of the UN to discuss and work together on a wide array of international issues covered by the UN Charter, such as development, peace and security, international law.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: Member states are likely to make commitments on biodiversity that may be relevant to the development of the post-2020 biodiversity process.

Title: Sustainable Development Impact Summit 2018
Meetings summary: During the UN General Assembly, this Forum brought together 700 business, government, civil society and academic leaders for discussions on sustainable development and to seek solutions to climate change.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This Forum represented an opportunity to raise the ambition and turn commitments into action on climate change and sustainable development.

Title: Post-2020 Stakeholder Workshop
Organisers: Institute for Biodiversity Network, German Federal Agency for Nature Conservation
Meetings summary: A stakeholder workshop was convened as part of a project analysing the structure and content of the current Strategic Plan for Biodiversity 2011-2020. This project has included the development of proposals for the further development of the Strategic Plan or a new target system.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The results of this discussion were integrated into the project study and can now serve to prepare for further negotiations, including COP, SBSTTA and SBI meetings

Title: Committee on Agriculture (COAG-26)
Meetings summary: The Committee on Agriculture (COAG) is one of the Food and Agriculture Organisation (FAO)’s Governing Bodies which aims to provide policy and regulatory guidance on issues relating to agriculture, livestock, food safety, nutrition, rural development and natural resource management.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This meeting provided an opportunity to consider pathways to sustainable food and agriculture that do not compromise biodiversity.

Title: Committee on World Food Security (CFS-46)
Meetings summary: The Food and Agriculture Organisation (FAO) Committee on World Food Security (CFS) is an international and intergovernmental platform for stakeholders to work together to address food security and nutrition-related issues.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This meeting provided an opportunity to enhance coordination among different sectors and establish linkages between biodiversity and food security.

Title: Ramsar COP13
Meetings summary: At the 13th meeting of the Conference of the Parties to the Ramsar Convention on Wetlands (Ramsar COP13), representatives of the governments of each of the Contracting Parties met to discuss, among other things the conservation and wise use of wetlands.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This meeting provided the opportunity to enhance synergies between the Ramsar Convention on Wetlands and the CBD.

Title: GEO-XV Plenary
Meetings summary: The Group on Earth Observations (GEO) Plenary is the highest decision-making body of GEO.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The GEO Plenary provided an opportunity to exchange knowledge, identify gaps and reduce duplication in the areas of sustainable development and environmental management.

Title: African Biodiversity Summit 2018
Organisers: Government of Egypt, CBD Secretariat, African Union, African Ministerial Conference on the Environment
Meetings summary: Prior to the UN Biodiversity Conference, this Summit brought together ministers of the African region. The theme of the Summit was “Land and ecosystem degradation and restoration: Priorities for increased resilience in Africa”.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This Summit allowed ministers to focus priorities which are relevant to developing the post-2020 global biodiversity framework.

Title: COP 14 Business and Biodiversity Forum
Meetings summary: The Business and Biodiversity Forums provided a platform for engagement and facilitated discussions between the Convention and Businesses.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The forum provided an opportunity for businesses to engage with the Convention on Biological Diversity on a number of topics, many of which will be relevant to developing the post-2020 global biodiversity framework.

Title: High Level Segment of the UN Biodiversity Conference 2018
Meetings summary: The High Level Segment of the fourteenth meeting of Conference of the Parties to the Convention on Biological Diversity (COP14) and concurrent meetings of the Cartagena and Nagoya Protocols will precede CBD COP14, the Cartagena Protocol on Biosafety COP-MOP 9 and the Nagoya Protocol on Access and Benefit-sharing COP-MOP 3. These meetings are collectively know as the "UN Biodiversity Conference 2018".
Relevance to the post-2020 process: It is expected that the High Level Segment will focus on the theme “Investing in Biodiversity for People and Planet”, considering in particular the sectors energy and mining, infrastructure, manufacturing and processing, and health. The intended objective of the event, with a declaration as its key output, would be to demonstrate high level political buy-in to guide the discussions on mainstreaming during the Conference of the Parties, ultimately thinking about the relevance of actions in these sectors for the 2030 Agenda.

Title: CBD COP14
Meetings summary: The 14th meeting of the Conference of the Parties to the Convention on Biological Diversity (CBD COP14) addressed a broad range of issues related to the objectives of the convention. This included a review of the Convention's progress and implementation, the mainstreaming of biodiversity into key sectors and progress towards developing a post-2020 global biodiversity framework.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The Parties adopted a preparatory process for the development of the post-2020 global biodiversity framework. This framework should be accompanied by an inspirational and motivating 2030 mission as a stepping stone towards the 2050 Vision. Amongst other things, there was also an assessment of the Convention's implementation of the Strategic Plan for Biodiversity 2011-2020 and progress towards achieving the Aichi Biodiversity targets.

Title: Cartagena Protocol on Biosafety COP-MOP 9
Meetings summary: The 9th Meeting of the Conference of the Parties serving as the Meeting of the Parties to the Cartagena Protocol on Biosafety (COP-MOP 9) was to review the implementation of the Cartagena Protocol on Biosafety and contributed to decisions to promote its effective operation.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The post-2020 global biodiversity framework covered the convention and its protocols.

Title: Nagoya Protocol on Access and Benefit-sharing COP-MOP 3
Meetings summary: The 3rd Meeting of the Conference of the Parties serving as the meeting of the Parties to the Nagoya Protocol on Access and Benefit-sharing (COP-MOP 3) reviewed the implementation of the Nagoya Protocol and made decisions to promote its effective operation.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The post-2020 global biodiversity framework will cover the convention and its protocols.

Title: 2018 G20 – Buenos Aires summit
Meetings summary: The Group of Twenty (G20) is a forum for international cooperation on financial and economic issues.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: Decisions taken by the G20 aimed to bring about reform at both the national and international level. This summit provided the opportunity to discuss linkages between biodiversity and economic and financial issues.

Title: UNFCCC COP24
Meetings summary: The twenty-fourth Conference of the Parties to the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC COP24) addressed a broad range of issues related to the objectives of the convention. This included a review of progress towards the Paris Climate Change Agreement, updates on guidelines for its implementation and transitions in key sectors that will be needed for the Paris Agreement to be met.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The meeting provided an opportunity to consider how the post-2020 global biodiversity framework and the implementation of the Paris agreement can be mutually supportive.

Title: Agreement on the Conservation of African-Eurasian Migratory Waterbirds MOP7
Meetings summary: The 7th Session of the Meeting of the Parties (MOP7) to the Agreement on the Conservation of African-Eurasian Migratory Waterbirds (AEWA) addressed many issues related to the implementation of the Agreement. In addition, a AEWA Strategic Plan 2019 – 2027 and a Plan of Action for Africa 2019 – 2027 were adopted.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The slogan for MOP7 is “Beyond 2020: Shaping flyway conservation for the future”. As the new AEWE Strategic Plan runs until 2027, it is likely to represent a relevant input to the post-2020 framework for global biodiversity.

Title: Deadline for initial views on the scope and content of the post-2020 global biodiversity framework
Meetings summary: SBI recommendation 2/19, on 'proposals for a comprehensive and participatory process for the preparation of the post-2020 global biodiversity framework', prompted a request for Parties and others to submit views on the scope and content of the post-2020 global biodiversity framework.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This provided an opportunity to submit relevant views, including on the scientific underpinning of the scale and possible scope of actions and on the possible structure of the post-2020 global biodiversity framework.

Title: Towards a Global Pact for the Environment: First Substantive Session
Meetings summary: This meeting is the first in a series which will consider a technical and evidence-based report that identifies and assesses possible gaps in international environmental law and environment-related instruments with a view to strengthening their implementation.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: It is expected environmental laws and their enforcement will play a role in strengthening the post-2020 agenda and meeting its aims and goals.

Title: World Economic Forum Annual Meeting 2019
Meetings summary: The World Economic Forum's annual meeting brought together leaders of global society including members of governments, global companies, international organisations, NGOs, and others to define priorities and shape global, industry and regional agendas.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: 2019's annual meeting hosted numerous events related to nature and biodiversity, ranging from the importance of biodiversity to human society, to how the finance and business sectors can play an important role in halting biodiversity loss. Engaging with other sectors is expected to form a part of the post-2020 agenda.

Title: Regional Consultation Workshop on the Post-2020 Global Biodiversity Framework for Asia and the Pacific
Meetings summary: This regional workshop involved Parties and relevant organisations in the Asia and Pacific Region in the preparatory process of constructing the post-2020 agenda.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: It is envisaged this workshop will act as part of the preparation process for the post-2020 agenda.

Title: The post-2020 Biodiversity Framework: Targets, indicators and measurability implications at global and national level
Meetings summary: This workshop brought together a range of experts and stakeholders from the policy, scientific and NGO community to share and exchange views on the development of the post-2020 biodiversity framework, with the aim of better understanding of the measurability implications, at global and national levels, of possible targets.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The discussions that took place at this workshop will contribute towards the design of the measurability aspect of the post-2020 biodiversity framework.

Title: UN World Wildlife Day 2019
Meetings summary: UN World Wildlife Day celebrated and raised awareness of the world's wild animals and plants.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: World Wildlife Day raised awareness of biodiversity which relates to Aichi Biodiversity Target 12 of the Strategic Plan for Biodiversity 2011-2020.

Title: World Ocean Summit 2019
Location: St Regis Saadiyat Resort, Abu Dhabi, UAE
Meetings summary: The sixth World Ocean Summit brought relevant people and stakeholders together to build greater collaboration across regions and connect the world to new ideas and perspectives.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This meeting brought together political leaders and policymakers, heads of global business, scientists, NGOs and multilaterals from across the globe, and provided a forum for discussion amongst a more diverse and representative participation on the future of the ocean.

Title: Fourth Session of the UN Environment Assembly (UNEA-4)
Meetings summary: This meeting brought together member states and a variety of stakeholders to discuss environmental issues and to share ideas to address these issues and make commitments to tackle them.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: One of the three main areas of focus of this meeting was tackling the issue of biodiversity loss, which, when finalised, will be done under the aims of the post-2020 agenda.

Title: Towards a Global Pact for the Environment: Second Substantive Session
Meetings summary: This meeting was the second in a series which will considered a technical and evidence-based report that identified and assessed possible gaps in international environmental law and environment-related instruments, with a view to strengthening their implementation.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: It is expected environmental laws and their enforcement will play a role in strengthening the post-2020 agenda and meeting its aims and goals.

Title: Regional Consultation Workshop on the Post-2020 Global Biodiversity Framework for the Western Europe and Others Group
Meetings summary: This regional workshop involved Parties and relevant organisations in the Western Europe and Others Group (WEOG) in the preparatory process of constructing the post-2020 agenda.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This workshop acted as part of the preparation process for the post-2020 agenda.

Title: Second Session of the Intergovernmental Conference on Marine Biodiversity of Areas Beyond National Jurisdiction
Meetings summary: This Intergovernmental Conference was the second session of four on developing an international legally binding instrument under the United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea on the conservation and sustainable use of marine biological diversity of areas beyond national jurisdiction.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This session made contributions towards developing an instrument that conserves and uses marine biodiversity in areas beyond national jurisdiction in a sustainable way. Regulations for managing biodiversity use in the deep seas do not currently exist and it is expected that this new, legally binding instrument once implemented will shape the post-2020 marine agenda.

Title: Regional Consultation Workshop on the Post-2020 Global Biodiversity Framework for Africa
Meetings summary: This regional workshop brought together Parties and relevant organisations in the regional Africa group as part of the preparatory process of constructing the post-2020 agenda.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This workshop acted as part of the preparation process for the post-2020 agenda with a specific focus on the African region.

Title: Expert workshop to develop recommendations for possible gender elements in the post-2020 global biodiversity framework
Meetings summary: This workshop brought together expertise on gender and biodiversity issues from civil society, international organisations, the UN system and National Focal Points, in order to identify possible gender elements for consideration in the development of the post-2020 global biodiversity framework.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The recommendations that resulted from this workshop will be shared as input into official submissions in developing the post-2020 framework, regional and global consultations and negotiations on the framework itself and the post-2020 discussion paper.

Title: IPBES-7 Plenary
Meetings summary: The seventh meeting of the Intergovernmental Science-Policy Platform on Biodiversity and Ecosystem Services (IPBES-7)  discussed the next work programme, deliverables and assessments.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This Plenary provided an opportunity to discuss how regional and sub-regional assessments can be used in planning and delivering of the post-2020 biodiversity agenda.

Title: G7 Environment Meeting
Meetings summary: The theme of the G7 Environment meeting was climate change and the four priorities were, (i) Combating inequality through an inclusive ecological transition, (ii) Supporting scientific warnings and international action on biodiversity and the climate, (iii) Promoting tangible solutions for the climate and biodiversity, and (iv) Financing the preservation of biodiversity.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: Member states  engaged in discussions on biodiversity that may be relevant to the development of the post-2020 biodiversity process.

Title: Regional Consultation on the Post-2020 Global Biodiversity Framework for Latin America and the Caribbean
Meetings summary: This regional workshop involved Parties and relevant organisations in the Latin America and Caribbean region in the preparatory process of constructing the post-2020 agenda.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This workshop was part of the preparation process for the post-2020 agenda.

Title: Regional Consultation on the Post-2020 Global Biodiversity Framework for Central and Eastern Europe
Meetings summary: This regional workshop involved Parties and relevant organisations in Central and Eastern Europe in the preparatory process of constructing the post-2020 agenda.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This workshop was part of the preparation process for the post-2020 agenda.

Title: Towards a Global Pact for the Environment: Third Substantive Session
Meetings summary: This meeting was the third in a series which considered a technical and evidence-based report that identifies and assesses possible gaps in international environmental law and environment-related instruments with a view to strengthening their implementation.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: It is expected environmental laws and their enforcement will play a role in strengthening the post-2020 agenda and meeting its aims and goals.

Title: International Day for Biological Diversity 2019
Meetings summary: This day was aimed at increasing an understanding and awareness of biodiversity issues. The theme of this year is, "Our Biodiversity, Our Food, Our Health”.

Title: Conference on "Biodiversity and Ecosystem Services"
Meetings summary: This meeting took stock of progress towards the EU nature and biodiversity objectives as well as launching the public consultation for the final evaluation of the EU Biodiversity Strategy. There will also be a series of technical discussions with stakeholders on the evaluation of the EU biodiversity strategy to 2020 and potential EU contributions to the post-2020 global biodiversity framework.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This meeting enabled discussions on how the EU will contribute towards the post-2020 agenda.

Title: IUCN Regional Conservation Forum for Mexico, Central America and the Caribbean
Meetings summary: Regional Conservation Forums (RCFs) are held as part of the preparatory work towards the IUCN World Conservation Congress. At the RCFs, IUCN Members' discussions include preparations towards the Congress including matters pertaining to the work Programme of IUCN for the next quadrennium and the potential policy motions to be submitted to the Congress for approval.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: Discussions during the 2019 RCFs helped to inform IUCN’s position regarding the post-2020 biodiversity framework.

Title: World Environment Day 2019
Meetings summary: World Environment Day is the United Nations’ day for encouraging worldwide awareness and action for the protection of our environment. It is celebrated in over 100 countries.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The day provides an opportunity for driving the momentum and public pressure for the upcoming CBD COP14.

Title: World Oceans Day 2019
Meetings summary: World Oceans Day is a day of ocean celebration, aiming to increase collaboration on ocean issues.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The day provides an opportunity to raise awareness of the problems facing our ocean.

Title: Consultation Workshop of Biodiversity-related Conventions on the Post-2020 Global Biodiversity Framework
Meetings summary: This meeting will bring together representatives of Parties to ten global conventions to identify how they may contribute to the development of the post-2020 global biodiversity framework.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: It is envisaged this meeting will result in recommendations of how the conventions can contribute to the post-2020 global biodiversity framework, as well as how the conventions can enhance synergies to achieve the aims of the framework once it is developed.

Title: Bonn Climate Change Conference (SBSTA-50/SBI-50)
Meetings summary: At this conference leaders of national governments, cities, states, business, investors, NGOs and civil society will gather to commit to climate action to meet the goals of the Paris Climate Agreement.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: It is envisaged the outcomes and level of commitment from this conference will have an impact on the content on the post-2020 agenda.

Title: IUCN Regional Conservation Forum for Europe, North and Central Asia
Meetings summary: Regional Conservation Forums (RCFs) are held as part of the preparatory work towards the IUCN World Conservation Congress. At the RCFs, IUCN Members' discussions include preparations towards the Congress including matters pertaining to the work Programme of IUCN for the next quadrennium and the potential policy motions to be submitted to the Congress for approval.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: It is expected that discussions during the 2019 RCFs will also help to inform IUCN’s position regarding the post-2020 biodiversity framework.

Title: Trondheim Conference on Biodiversity
Meetings summary: The Trondheim Conferences are a result of collaboration between the Secretariat of the UN Convention on Biological Diversity (CBD), United Nations Environment and the Norwegian government and are held every 3-4 years. The Trondheim Conferences provide an opportunity for consultation on scientific views and issues of relevance to CBD.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The Trondheim Conference for Biodiversity could be used to convene the CBD's first global consultation workshop. This would focus on scientific issues related to the post-2020 global biodiversity framework.

Title: High-level Political Forum on Sustainable Development 2019
Meetings summary: The theme of the High-level Political Forum on Sustainable Development (HLPF) 2019 will be: “Empowering people and ensuring inclusiveness and equality”. The sub-set of Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) to be reviewed in depth by HLPF 2019 will be: SDG 4, 8, 10, 13, 16 and 17.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The HLPF has a central role in the follow-up and review of the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development and its SDGs at the global level. The forum provides an opportunity to demonstrate how biodiversity underpins all of the 17 SDGs.

Title: Third Session of the Intergovernmental Conference on Marine Biodiversity of Areas Beyond National Jurisdiction
Meetings summary: This Intergovernmental Conference is the third session of four on developing an international legally binding instrument under the United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea on the conservation and sustainable use of marine biological diversity of areas beyond national jurisdiction.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: These sessions will provide an opportunity to develop an instrument that conserves and uses marine biodiversity in areas beyond national jurisdiction in a sustainable way. Regulations for managing biodiversity use in the deep seas do not currently exist and it is expected that this new, legally binding instrument once implemented will shape the post-2020 marine agenda.

Title: G7 Summit 2019
Meetings summary: The G7 Summit will concentrate on identifying common responses to address major global challenges including peace and security, counter-terrorism, development, education, health, the environment and climate change.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: Member states are likely to make commitments on biodiversity that may be relevant to the development of the post-2020 biodiversity process.

Title: Global Consultation Workshop on the Post-2020 Global Biodiversity Framework, Biosafety and the Cartagena Protocol
Meetings summary: It is envisaged this global consultation workshop will discuss biosafety under the post-2020 global biodiversity framework, prior to the First meeting of the Open-Ended Working Group on the Post-2020 Global Biodiversity Framework.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: Parties of the Catagena Protocol on biosafety have stressed the importance of including biosafety in the post-2020 biodiversity framework. This workshop is one of the main steps in the development of biosafety aspects under the new framework.

Title: Global Consultation Workshop on the Post-2020 Global Biodiversity Framework in relation to Access and Benefit-sharing and the Nagoya Protocol
Meetings summary: It is envisaged this global consultation workshop will discuss Access and Benefit sharing under the post-2020 global biodiversity framework, prior to the First meeting of the Open-Ended Working Group on the Post-2020 Global Biodiversity Framework.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: Parties of the Nagoya Protocol on Access and Benefit-sharing have stressed the importance of its inclusion in the post-2020 biodiversity framework. This workshop is one of the main steps in the development of Access and Benefit-sharing aspects under the new framework.

Title: First meeting of the Open-ended Working Group on the Post-2020 Global Biodiversity Framework
Meetings summary: This will be the first meeting of the open-ended intersessional working group in developing the post-2020 global biodiversity framework.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The open-ended intersessional working group in developing the post-2020 global biodiversity framework will meet multiple times in 2019-2020, prior to the fifteenth meeting of the Conference of the Parties to the Convention on Biological Diversity. These sessions negotiations will shape and define the post-2020 agenda.

Title: UNCCD COP14
Meetings summary: The fourteenth meeting of the Conference of the Parties to the UN Convention to Combat Desertification (UNCCD COP 14) will assess progress and implementation of the commitments to achieve Land Degradation Neutrality (LDN).
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The meeting provides an opportunity to consider how the post-2020 global biodiversity framework and the UNCCD 2018-2030 Strategic Framework can be mutually supportive.

Title: OceanObs'19: An Ocean of opportunity
Meetings summary: As part of the decadal conference series, the OceanObs’19 conference will bring together ocean observing communities, aiming to improve coordination of regional and national efforts to better observe the global ocean, to better respond to the joint scientific and societal needs of a fit-for-purpose ocean observing system, and maximise the overall benefit of more integrated observing.​ A set of Community Whitepapers will be published in a peer reviewed journal.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This conference is likely to provide recommendations on the use of global ocean observation data.

Title: UNGA 74
Meetings summary: The 74th Session of the UN General Assembly (UNGA 74) will bring together all 193 Member States of the UN to discuss and work together on a wide array of international issues covered by the UN Charter, such as development, peace and security, international law.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This is an opportunity to raise the political profile of the post-2020 process.

Title: UN Climate Action Summit
Meetings summary: The 2019 Climate Action Summit comes exactly one year before countries have to enhance their national climate pledges under the Paris Agreement, and it is hoped to boost ambition and acceleration in actions towards implementing the Paris Agreement.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The level of ambition of the pledges under the Paris Agreement will influence the nature of the post-2020 agenda.

Title: III Latin American and Caribbean Congress of Protected Areas
Meetings summary: The theme for the meeting is focused on ”Solutions for welfare and sustainable development”. The meeting will provide a space for experience exchange, debate on the formulation and implementation of public policies, research and academia. The Congress is an initiative from the International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN) and its World Commission on Protected Areas (WCPA).
Relevance to the post-2020 process: III Latin American and Caribbean Congress of Protected Areas provides an opportunity for countries to take a regional position at the next IUCN World Conservation Congress, in 2020.

Title: biodiversity_next
Organisers: Biodiversity Information Standards TDWG, Global Biodiversity Information Facility, Distributed System of Scientific Collections, Consortium of European Taxonomic Facilities, Integrated Digitized Biocollections
Meetings summary: The biodiversity_next conference aims to bring together major international organisations, research scientists and policy makers in order to identify socio-technical bottlenecks and discuss opportunities around data-intensive biodiversity and geodiversity research.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This is an opportunity for discussions around how effective use of data can contribute towards achieving the post-2020 agenda.

Title: WG8J-11
Meetings summary: The 11th meeting of the Ad Hoc Open-ended Working Group on Article 8(j) and Related Provisions of the Convention on Biological Diversity (WG8J-11) will examine the potential role of traditional knowledge, customary sustainable use and the contribution of the collective actions of indigenous peoples and local communities in the conservation of biological diversity.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This is an opportunity to engage and involve indigenous and local communities in discussions related to the post-2020 global biodiversity framework.

Title: African Protected Areas Congress 2019
Organisers: Government of Kenya, IUCN World Commission on Protected Areas, UN Environment
Meetings summary: This meeting aims to bring together specialists on Protected Areas to discuss challenges and opportunities of African Protected Areas.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This meeting will provide an opportunity to contribute to discussions on area-based targets ahead of COP15.

Title: Eleventh meeting of the Working Group on Article 8 (j)
CBD SBSTTA-23
Meetings summary: The Convention on Biological Diversity's (CBD) twenty-third meeting of the Subsidiary Body on Scientific, Technical and Technological Advice (SBSTTA-23) will focus on scientific and technical preparation for the CBD COP in 2020.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The meeting will include discussions regarding the follow up to the Strategic Plan for Biodiversity 2011-2020. Of particular relevance will be the ongoing review of progress towards the Strategic Plan for Biodiversity 2011-2020 and options for accelerating progress.

Title: UNFCCC COP 25
Meetings summary: The twenty-fifth Conference of the Parties to the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC COP25) will address a broad range of issues related to the objectives of the convention. This will include a review of progress towards the Paris Climate Change Agreement, updates on guidelines for its implementation and transitions in key sectors that will be needed for the Paris Agreement to be met.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The meeting will provide an opportunity to consider how the post-2020 global biodiversity framework and the implementation of the Paris agreement can be mutually supportive.

Title: 10th Session of the World Urban Forum
Meetings summary: The Tenth Session of the World Urban Forum (WUF10) will focus on the implementation of the New Urban Agenda as an approach to achieve Agenda 2030 and the Sustainable Development Goals.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This forum represents an opportunity to engage in discussions on the linkages between cities and biodiversity

Title: CMS COP13
Meetings summary: The thirteenth Conference of the Parties to the Convention on the Conservation of Migratory Species of Wild Animals will address a broad range of issues related to the objectives of the convention.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The meeting provides an opportunity to consider how the post-2020 global biodiversity framework and the implementation of the Strategic Plan for Migratory Species 2015-2023 can be mutually supportive.

Title: World Biodiversity Forum
Meetings summary: 2020 will see a new global biodiversity framework – "New Deal for Nature" – that will pave the way to achieve the 2050 vision of the Convention on Biological Diversity – "Living in Harmony with Nature". This conference will contribute to this vision by viewing biodiversity through the lens of an Earth system approach; investigate the intertwined impacts of drivers of global environmental change on biodiversity and ecosystems, and highlight the benefits and solutions biodiversity and ecosystems provide to sustainable development.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This meeting aims to contribute to the post-2020 biodiversity framework, and in turn the 2050 vision of the CBD, through an Earth system approach.

Title: CBD SBSTTA-24
Meetings summary: The Convention on Biological Diversity's (CBD) twenty-fourth meeting of the Subsidiary Body on Scientific, Technical and Technological Advice (SBSTTA-24) will focus on scientific and technical preparation for the CBD COP in 2020.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The meeting will include discussions regarding the follow up to the Strategic Plan for Biodiversity 2011-2020. Of particular relevance will be the ongoing review of progress towards the Strategic Plan for Biodiversity 2011-2020 and options for accelerating progress. The draft of the post-2020 global biodiversity framework will be considered, with a view to providing advice on targets to SBI-3.

Title: CBD SBI-3
Meetings summary: The Convention on Biological Diversity's (CBD) second meeting of the Subsidiary Body on Implementation (SBI-2) will focus on progress in the implementation preparation for the CBD COP in November 2018.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The post-2020 global biodiversity framework will be considered, with a view to developing a recommendation for COP-15.

Title: International Day for Biological Diversity 2020
Meetings summary: This is a day to increase an understanding and awareness of biodiversity issues.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This day is relevant to raising awareness and building momentum in the lead up to COP-15.

Title: World Environment Day 2020
Meetings summary: World Environment Day is the United Nations’ day for encouraging worldwide awareness and action for the protection of our environment. It is celebrated in over 100 countries.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The day provides an opportunity for driving the momentum and public awareness of nature, a key aspect in the lead up to COP-15.

Title: Bonn Climate Change Conference (SBSTA-52/SBI-52)
Meetings summary: At this conference leaders of national governments, cities, states, business, investors, NGOs and civil society will gather to commit to climate action to meet the goals of the Paris Climate Agreement.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: It is envisaged the outcomes and level of commitment from this conference will have an impact on the content on the post-2020 agenda.

Title: World Oceans Day 2020
Meetings summary: World Oceans Day is a day of ocean celebration, aiming to increase collaboration on ocean issues.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The day provides an opportunity to raise awareness of the problems facing our ocean.

Title: IUCN World Conservation Congress
Meetings summary: The IUCN World Conservation Congress brings together several thousand leaders and decision-makers from government, civil society, indigenous peoples, business, and academia, with the goal of conserving the environment and harnessing the solutions nature offers to global challenges. The Congress aims to improve how we manage our natural environment for human, social and economic development, but this cannot be achieved by conservationists alone.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The IUCN World Conservation Congresses produce a number of outcomes that set the direction for the Union for the next four years. It is expected that the different outcomes from Congress will provide recommendations for the CBD's COP15, and aim to support the wider implementation of the Convention, its objectives, and the international sustainable development agenda.

Title: Meeting of the Open-ended Working Group on the Post-2020 Global Biodiversity Framework
Meetings summary: This will be the one of the open-ended intersessional working group meetings in developing the post-2020 global biodiversity framework.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The open-ended intersessional working group in developing the post-2020 global biodiversity framework will meet multiple times in 2019-2020, prior to the fifteenth meeting of the Conference of the Parties to the Convention on Biological Diversity. These sessions negotiations will shape and define the post-2020 agenda.

Title: UNGA 75
Meetings summary: The 75th Session of the UN General Assembly (UNGA 75) will bring together all 193 Member States of the UN to discuss and work together on a wide array of international issues covered by the UN Charter, such as development, peace and security, international law.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: This is an opportunity to raise the political profile of the post-2020 process.

Title: CBD COP15
Meetings summary: The fifteenth meeting of the Conference of the Parties (COP15) to the Convention on Biological Diversity (CBD) will review the achievement and delivery of the CBD's Strategic Plan for Biodiversity 2011-2020. Furthermore, decision on the post-2020 global biodiversity framework will be made, together with decisions on related topics including capacity building and resource mobilisation.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: It is anticipated that the final decision of the post-2020 global biodiversity framework will be taken at this meeting.

Title: Cartagena Protocol on Biosafety COPMOP10
Meetings summary: The tenth Meeting of the Parties serving as the meeting of the Parties to the Cartagena Protocol on Biosafety (COPMOP10) will review the implementation of the Cartagena Protocol and makes decisions to promote its effective operation.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: It is anticipated that the post-2020 global biodiversity framework will cover the convention and its protocols.

Title: Nagoya Protocol on Access and Benefit-sharing COPMOP4
Meetings summary: The fourth meeting of the Conference of the Parties serving as the meeting of the Parties to the Nagoya Protocol on Access and Benefit-sharing (COPMOP4) will review the implementation of the Nagoya Protocol and makes decisions to promote its effective operation.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: It is anticipated that the post-2020 global biodiversity framework will cover the convention and its protocols.

Title: UNFCCC COP26
Meetings summary: The twenty-sixth Conference of the Parties to the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC COP26) will address a broad range of issues related to the objectives of the convention. This will include a review of progress towards the Paris Climate Change Agreement, updates on guidelines for its implementation and transitions in key sectors that will be needed for the Paris Agreement to be met.
Relevance to the post-2020 process: The meeting provides an opportunity to consider how the post-2020 global biodiversity framework and the implementation of the Paris agreement can be mutually supportive.
